Directions
Adjust oven rack to middle position and preheat oven to 350°F (175ºC). On a 13- by 18-inch rimmed baking sheet, spread pecan halves in a single layer. Select 24 perfect, unbroken pecan halves; transfer to a small bowl and set aside for topping. Bake remaining pecan halves in preheated oven until fragrant and toasted, 7 to 8 minutes. Let cool slightly, about 5 minutes.
Serious Eats / Robby Lozano
Measure out 1/4 cup (about 32g) toasted pecans. Transfer to a food processor. Process until finely ground, 10 to 20 seconds. Set ground pecans aside for dough. Chop remaining pecans; set aside for filling.
Serious Eats / Robby Lozano
Prepare the Dough
: In a large bowl, beat together softened butter and cream cheese with a flexible spatula until smooth and creamy. Add flour, salt, and reserved ground pecans. Stir together until a cohesive dough forms. Divide dough into 24 one-inch balls, about 14g or 1/2 ounce each.
Serious Eats / Robby Lozano
Press 1 dough ball into each cup of a nonstick 24-cup mini muffin pan.  Gently and evenly press dough into the bottom and up the sides of each cup. Transfer pan to freezer; chill until firmed, about 15 minutes.
Serious Eats / Robby Lozano
Meanwhile, prepare the filling:
In a medium bowl, whisk brown sugar, maple syrup, butter, bourbon, vanilla, egg, zest, and salt together until smooth.
Serious Eats / Robby Lozano
Remove muffin pan from freezer. Spoon about 1 teaspoon reserved chopped pecans into each cup. Pour 2 teaspoons filling into each cup. Top each cup with 1 reserved untoasted pecan half.
Serious Eats / Robby Lozano
Bake until crust is lightly golden and filling is bubbling, 25 to 28 minutes. Let cool slightly, about 5 minutes. Invert tassies onto a wire rack, then turn them right-side-up, and let cool completely on wire rack, about 30 minutes.
Serious Eats / Robby Lozano
Variations
You can add 1/4 cup mini chocolate chips or chopped chocolate (1/2 teaspoon per tassie) along with the chopped pecans for chocolate-pecan tassies.
You can swap pecans for another nut or a mixture of nuts.
Special Equipment
Rimmed baking sheet, food processor, flexible spatula, nonstick 24-cup mini muffin pan, medium bowl, wire rack
Make Ahead and Storage
Dough can be prepared up to 1 day in advance and stored tightly wrapped in the refrigerator. Bring to room temperature before pressing into muffin pan (cold dough will result in cracked edges).
Pies can be stored in an airtight container for up to 5 days.
